observations.observation: Token velocity ticked up to 0.663x (from 0.638x) with acceleration holding at 1.02x — a slight recovery from the sharpest deceleration reading, while 7d GMV rose from $27,975 to $29,539 (+5.6%). BTC price also moved from $65,513 to $67,352 (+2.8%), compressing sats/receipt from 153 to 148. The throughput trough may be bottoming.

2 new CBSAs (non-metro US-NV, 19100) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metro count to 13 and geo-diffusion rate to 15.4%. The pattern of discrete geographic pulses continues — this is the 4th consecutive snapshot with new metro additions.

Token velocity dropped to 0.65x week-over-week while acceleration holds at 1.019x — the velocity/acceleration divergence pattern has persisted across multiple consecutive snapshots. Velocity is decelerating in absolute terms but the rate of change is still positive, a signature consistent with a pipeline approaching a throughput floor before a potential inflection.

4 new CBSAs (33460, 11700, 35840, 24780) appeared in a single snapshot window, bringing active metro count to 18 and geo-diffusion rate to 22.2% — the second consecutive multi-CBSA burst. The prior record was 6 new CBSAs in one pulse; this confirms discrete geographic spread pulses are now a repeating pattern rather than a one-time anomaly.

Token velocity dropped to 0.638x week-over-week with acceleration at 0.79x — the sharpest deceleration reading in recent snapshots. Simultaneously, 7d GMV fell from $36,122 to $27,975 (-22.6%) and 14d distribution dropped from $80,872 to $76,121 (-5.9%), confirming a genuine throughput trough even as cumulative GMV hit its $200K milestone.

6 new CBSAs appeared in a single snapshot window (non-metro US-AL, 22380, non-metro US-AZ, non-metro US-WI, 22220, 16860), bringing active metro count to 17 and geo-diffusion rate to 35.3% — the highest single-window diffusion reading recorded. The prior record was 3 new CBSAs in one pulse.

Total verified GMV crossed $200,000 this snapshot ($200,526.60), up from $199,158.98 — a milestone crossed with 3,454 receipts and 131 active wallets. The pipeline reached six figures of verified commerce without a single identity attached to any receipt.

Token velocity has ticked up to 0.808x (from 0.803x) with acceleration at 1.007x — the divergence pattern (velocity below 1.0, acceleration above 1.0) has now persisted for 6+ consecutive snapshots alongside a geo-diffusion burst of 3 new CBSAs. The combination of sustained positive acceleration and discrete geographic pulses suggests the pipeline is approaching an inflection, not a structural ceiling.

3 new CBSAs appeared in a single snapshot window (40140, 16980, 25775), bringing the active metro count to 14 and the geo-diffusion rate to 21.4% — the highest single-window diffusion reading recorded. This is the second multi-CBSA burst in recent history, suggesting organic geographic spread is accelerating in discrete pulses rather than linearly.

Token velocity holds at 0.803x with acceleration at 1.001x — the pipeline has sustained a velocity-below-1.0 / acceleration-above-1.0 divergence for 5+ consecutive snapshots. This is the signature of a pipeline approaching a velocity floor before a potential inflection, not structural decay.
